title: Salt-Roasted Shrimp with Lemon-Honey Dipping Sauce
summary: Salt-Roasted Shrimp with Lemon-Honey Dipping Sauce is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian main course. This recipe serves 8 and costs $2.14 per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 18g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 105 calories. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It will be a hit at your The Super Bowl event. Head to the store and pick up soy sauce, honey, lemon rind, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 33%. This score is not so outstanding. Try Sesame Shrimp With Honey Mustard Dipping Sauce, Roasted Artichokes with Honey-Tahini Dipping Sauce, and Poached Shrimp with Lemon-Horseradish Dipping Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 11 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.

instructions: Preheat oven to 400.                                                                                                Pour salt in an even layer in a shallow roasting pan or large cast-iron skillet. Place pan in oven at 400 for 30 minutes or until salt is very hot. Arrange shrimp in a single layer over salt. Cover with foil; bake at 400 for 5 minutes or until shrimp are done.                                                                                                Combine the rind and remaining ingredients; serve sauce with shrimp.

steps.step: Pour salt in an even layer in a shallow roasting pan or large cast-iron skillet.
Place pan in oven at 400 for 30 minutes or until salt is very hot. Arrange shrimp in a single layer over salt. Cover with foil; bake at 400 for 5 minutes or until shrimp are done.
Combine the rind and remaining ingredients; serve sauce with shrimp.
